title: get_daily_vol ValueError, length mismatch
body:
Hi, thanks for the great work on this library.

I am using the `util.get_daily_vol` function with a pandas series of close prices indexed by a pandas TimeStamp. The index contains second to second granularity.

When I use the `get_daily_vol` function, I get the error

```
mlfinlab.util.get_daily_vol(df["close"], 50)
>>> ValueError: operands could not be broadcast together with shapes (40387,) (40351,) 
```

It seems that when reindexing to daily close, some of the values get dropped [here](https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/mlfinlab/blob/master/mlfinlab/util/volatility.py#L34), so then the error occurs [here](https://github.com/hudson-and-thames/mlfinlab/blob/master/mlfinlab/util/volatility.py#L36).

I even tried coding the function myself from scratch from the book since its so short, and I get the same error.

Probably this is not a bug in the code, but more likely an issue with the data I am feeding in? Although the documentation does say that `close` is a `pd.Series` and `lookback` is an `int`, so I cannot see the issue. Here is a sample of the data, 

```
df
>>>
TimeStamp                   close
2018-02-10 00:10:18         8700.00
2018-02-10 00:20:27         8791.01
2018-02-10 00:21:13         8800.00
....
```

is there something wrong with this data? What datatype(s) would you suggest inputting into `get_daily_vol`?

Thanks in advance.
